section.title: Description
section.b: This step verifies the style of a specified cell in an Excel spreadsheet. Only those properties set will be checked.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: The description of this test step.

attribute.name: format
attribute.description: The format to check for. eg 0.00 for two decimal places.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The expected cell type. One of blank, numeric, formula, string, boolean or error.

attribute.name: align
attribute.description: The expected horizontal alignment. One of center, center-selection, fill, general, justify, left, right

attribute.name: valign
attribute.description: The expected vertical alignment. One of bottom, center, justify, top

attribute.name: wrap
attribute.description: The expected wrap setting. true or false

attribute.name: fontStyle
attribute.description: The expected font style. A combination of bold, italic, strikethrough, subscript, superscript, underline, underline-accounting, underline-double, underline-double-accounting separated by spaces, or normal

attribute.name: locked
attribute.description: The expected locked status. true or false

attribute.name: fontName
attribute.description: The expected font name. eg. Arial or Times

attribute.name: fontSize
attribute.description: The expected font size in points. eg 10 or 12

attribute.name: border
attribute.description: The expected border style. One of dash dot, dash dot dot, dashed, dotted, double, hair, medium, medium dash dot, medium dash dot dot, medium dashed, slanted dash dot, thick, thin, none. See below for details on specifying sides.

attribute.name: borderColor
attribute.description: The expected border color. Specify as #rrggbb or use a standard name. See below for details on specifying sides.

attribute.name: textColor
attribute.description: The expected text color. Specify as #rrggbb or use a standard name.

attribute.name: fillColor
attribute.description: The expected foreground cell fill color. Specify as #rrggbb or use a standard name.

attribute.name: fillBackgroundColor
attribute.description: The expected background cell fill color. Specify as #rrggbb or use a standard name.

attribute.name: fillPattern
attribute.description: The expected fill pattern. One of none, solid, 50% gray, 75% gray, 25% gray, horizontal stripe, vertical stripe, reverse diagonal stripe, diagonal stripe, diagonal crosshatch, thick diagonal crosshatch, thin horizontal stripe, thin vertical stripe, thin reverse diagonal stripe, thin diagonal stripe, thin horizontal crosshatch, thin diagonal crosshatch, 12.5% gray, 6.25% gray

attribute.name: cell
attribute.description: The spreadsheet cell to select. eg. A5. Either cell or row and col must be specified.

attribute.name: row
attribute.description: The number of the row to select, starting at 1. Either cell or row and col must be specified.

attribute.name: col
attribute.description: The name or number (starting at 1) of the column to select. eg 1 or A. Either cell or row and col must be specified.

attribute.name: sheetName
attribute.description: The name of the sheet to select. If no sheet is selected, the value of the last excelSelectSheet call is used, or defaults to the first sheet.

attribute.name: sheetIndex
attribute.description: The index of the sheet to select, starting at zero. If no sheet is selected, the value of the last excelSelectSheet call is used, or defaults to the first sheet.

For the borderColor, textColor, fillColor and fillBackgroundColor properties, you can use the following standard color names instead of hex values: aqua, black, blue, blue gray, bright green, brown, coral, dark blue, dark green, dark purple, dark red, dark teal, dark yellow, gold, green, 25% gray, 40% gray, 50% gray, 80% gray, ice blue, indigo, ivory, lavender, light blue, light green, light orange, light turquoise, light yellow, lime, maroon, ocean blue, olive green, orange, pale blue, periwinkle, pink, plum, red, rose, sea green, sky blue, tan, teal, turquoise, violet, white, yellow.
